metadata.synopsis: Default dialogue for Gortash's mother, Sally Flymm, at Flymm Cobblers in the Lower City. Gortash tadpoled his parents, who sold him into slavery in his youth. They are aware of their state but cannot resist the tadpole's compulsion - which makes them appear as huge fans of their son.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- goto -36 22 -109- Talk to Gortash's mother, Sally Flymm.

51.speaker: Sally Flymm
51.text: Ah, saer, be very welcome to the family home of the soon-sworn Archduke, Enver Gortash!

55.speaker: Sally Flymm
55.text: Pardon us, saer. This house is in mourning.

32.speaker: Sally Flymm
32.text: Our son, the city's saviour Enver Gortash, was slain by Absolutist conspirators.

78.speaker: Sally Flymm
78.text: Ah, saer, you've chosen a special day to visit the family home of Archduke Enver Gortash.

16.speaker: Sally Flymm
16.text: We're celebrating our dear son's magnificent achievement with a special run of leather-soled shoes.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Gods - Gortash has a mother?! I assumed he sprang fully-formed from a lich's arsecrack or something.
24.context: NodeContext: Aside, to the player, not too loud.

82.speaker: Karlach
82.text: Gods - Gortash has a mother?! I assumed he sprang fully-formed from a lich's arsecrack or something.
82.context: NodeContext: Aside, to the player, not too loud.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Connect your tadpole to hers - delve into her mind.
66.context: NodeContext: 'tiefling' spat out with hatred. She's a racist nasty.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Connect your tadpole to hers - delve into her mind.
17.context: NodeContext: 'tiefling' spat out with hatred. She's a racist nasty.

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *You search her mind, but the psionic forces that control her are different - split, somehow. Your own consciousness slips into the gap.*
11.context: NodeContext: 'tiefling' spat out with hatred. She's a racist nasty.

70.speaker: Sally Flymm
70.text: Help me. Gods, help me! Enver's ruined my mind. He's taken my body!
70.context: NodeContext: 'tiefling' spat out with hatred. She's a racist nasty.

81.speaker: Sally Flymm
81.text: I should've slammed the door in his face. But I let him in, and he rammed some kind of worm in our eyes.
81.context: NodeContext: 'tiefling' spat out with hatred. She's a racist nasty.

39.speaker: Sally Flymm
39.text: I'm here. But I can't speak. I can't act. I'm trapped.
39.context: NodeContext: 'tiefling' spat out with hatred. She's a racist nasty.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: You're not the only one he's hurt. Why would he do this?
48.context: NodeContext: 'tiefling' spat out with hatred. She's a racist nasty.

61.speaker: Sally Flymm
61.text: He said he wanted to make us 'powerless'.
61.context: NodeContext: 'tiefling' spat out with hatred. She's a racist nasty.

58.speaker: Sally Flymm
58.text: Still bitter after all these years. But we did what was best for him - for all of us.
58.context: NodeContext: 'tiefling' spat out with hatred. She's a racist nasty.

3.speaker: Sally Flymm
3.text: We had debts. World-ending debts, trying to keep this cursed shop afloat. Dangerous lenders who said they'd bury us all if we didn't pay.
3.context: NodeContext: 'tiefling' spat out with hatred. She's a racist nasty.

42.speaker: Sally Flymm
42.text: Then, a warlock offered us a pretty penny for Enver's service. He was a smart boy - too smart. It was give him up - and all of us live - or refuse, and die.
42.context: NodeContext: 'tiefling' spat out with hatred. She's a racist nasty.

49.speaker: Sally Flymm
49.context: NodeContext: 'tiefling' spat out with hatred. She's a racist nasty.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: You had every choice. You sold your son to a warlock - that's unforgivable.
71.context: NodeContext: 'tiefling' spat out with hatred. She's a racist nasty.

12.speaker: Sally Flymm
12.text: We got good coin for him. Closed our debts, and all of us kept our lives - Enver included.
12.context: NodeContext: 'tiefling' spat out with hatred. She's a racist nasty.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I feel bad for Gortash. That's a first.

45.speaker: Sally Flymm
45.text: Don't you judge me, tiefling. We got good coin for him. Closed our debts, and all of us kept our lives - Enver included.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: You may not have intended to, but you created a monster.

10.speaker: Sally Flymm
10.text: He was always a little monster. Nasty to the core. He would've torn me and Dravo apart with his whining, his demands, the never-ending racket of him!

67.speaker: Sally Flymm
67.text: You may disagree. Enver did. But we don't deserve this - this torment. You're the first person who's heard the real me in months.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Why would I help you after what you did to your own son?

68.speaker: Sally Flymm
68.text: My son! You've seen what he's like. Same now as when he was a boy. Hateful little wretch.

74.speaker: Sally Flymm
74.text: If you were me, you'd've sent him away too. Believe you me.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: You deserve what you got - and more.

9.speaker: Sally Flymm
9.text: Maybe. Maybe not. It's for the gods to judge me - not my wicked son. And not you.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: There's nothing I can do for you, at least for now - I'm sorry.

69.speaker: Sally Flymm
69.text: There has to be. I can't live like this. I'm trapped - trapped!

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I can put you out of your misery, if you like.

52.speaker: Sally Flymm
52.text: There has to be another way. I deserve to live again - I deserve my own life!

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *Your tadpole lashes and recoils. The connection is broken.*

22.speaker: Player
22.text: A very fair trade, if you ask me.

63.speaker: Sally Flymm
63.text: At least we all lived - Enver included. But he didn't see it that way. Stormed in here like we were murderers and he was the hand of justice itself.

0.speaker: Sally Flymm
0.text: You can't leave us like this. You're the first person who's heard the real me in months.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Why would Enver do this to you?

20.speaker: Sally Flymm
20.text: We hadn't seen him in so long. I knew he was an animal, but I underestimated him.

57.speaker: Sally Flymm
57.text: He sauntered in. 'Lord Gortash'. What a name. Conjured up like a cheap trick. Said he was back - for good - and he wanted to repay us for his childhood.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: He infected you with a mind flayer tadpole. I have one too - but for now, they can't be cured.

27.speaker: Sally Flymm
27.text: You can't leave me like this. You can't leave me in this hell!

8.speaker: Sally Flymm
8.text: I hope he rots in the Hells, where he belongs. He always was a nasty little monster.

77.speaker: Sally Flymm
77.text: I should've killed him when he was babe in my lap. He was a nasty little freak, even then. The bastard. The bastard!

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

62.speaker: Sally Flymm
62.text: Help me. Dear gods, help me!

7.speaker: Sally Flymm
7.text: Help me. Dear gods, help me!

28.text: You will keep your magic in hand, saer. In our Enver's own home! Disgusting.

56.speaker: Sally Flymm
56.text: You will keep your magic in hand, saer. In our Enver's own home! Disgusting.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: A pleasure to meet the mother of the Archduke.
15.context: NodeContext: Sad; her son is dead

46.speaker: Sally Flymm
46.text: His one and only. My, but he's made us proud. Such humble beginnings, and look at him now.

47.speaker: Sally Flymm
47.text: I've been crying happy tears all this tenday. What more could a mother want for her little boy?

38.speaker: Player
38.text: So you're to blame for the rise of that charlatan.
38.context: NodeContext: Sad; her son is dead

30.speaker: Sally Flymm
30.text: You've chosen the wrong household to argue politics, my friend. Shop, if you like, but let's talk no more of my son.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Do I take it you're Lord Gortash's mother?
31.context: NodeContext: Sad; her son is dead

19.speaker: Sally Flymm
19.text: May he rest in peace, our sweet boy. This world will never see his like again.
19.context: NodeContext: Sad; her son is dead

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *Your tadpole squirms. These people are infected with the parasite - but something is... off.*

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I know what you did. I know that you sold your son into slavery.
2.context: NodeContext: A little uncanny, since the paradox of her brain is being called into question.

29.speaker: Sally Flymm
29.text: Oh. Oh no. You have things very, very wrong. A dutiful mother would never do something so heinous. A good mother couldn't have fathomed such a horror.
29.context: NodeContext: A little uncanny, since the paradox of her brain is being called into question.

80.speaker: Sally Flymm
80.text: We love our son Enver. We love him so much.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Show me what you have in stock.

35.speaker: Sally Flymm
35.text: That's generations of tradition for you!

83.speaker: Sally Flymm
83.text: That's generations of tradition for you!

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Put her out of her misery - violently.

73.speaker: Sally Flymm
73.text: My goodness! What are you doing?!

86.speaker: Sally Flymm
86.text: May he rest in peace, our lad.
